definition: lit. to scratch the outside of the boot (idiom)/fig. beside the point/ineffectual
to separate/to partition/to stand or lie between/at a distance from/after or at an interval of
variant of 靴[xue1]
boots
to scratch/old variant of 騷|骚[sao1]
variant of 癢|痒[yang3]/to itch/to tickle
to itch/to tickle

sentences.english: Capturing text of interest just scratches the surface.
sentences.chinese: 捕获感兴趣的文本仅仅是隔靴搔痒。

sentences.english: But this is the rub of course, because conspiracy theories are self-sealing.
sentences.chinese: 但这只是隔靴搔痒而已，因为阴谋论都是自动生成的。

sentences.english: But if a pandemic does occur, this would be small comfort indeed.
sentences.chinese: 但是，如果流行病真的发生了，这将只是隔靴搔痒。

definition: to speak in general terms

blind people touch an elephant (idiom, from Nirvana sutra 大般涅槃經|大般涅盘经[da4 ban1 Nie4 pan2 jing1]); fig. unable to see the big picture/to mistake the part for the whole/unable to see the wood for the trees
to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge
to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge/also written 淺嘗輒止|浅尝辄止
lit. doesn't hurt, doesn't tickle (idiom); sth is wrong, but not quite sure what/fig. not getting to any matter of substance/scratching the surface/superficial/perfunctory
to treat the symptoms/reactive (rather than proactive)
empty cave, nothing there (idiom); devoid of substance/nothing new to show
to treat the symptoms but not the root cause
cannon fire to hit a mosquito/to use a sledgehammer to crack a nut
lit. drinking poison in the hope of quenching one's thirst (idiom)/fig. a supposed remedy that only makes matters worse
lit. climb a tree to catch a fish (idiom); fig. to attempt the impossible
to become a mere formality
not to affect sb/irrelevant/of no importance/insignificant
(of a writing etc) to have no substance (idiom)/to carry no weight
grandiose but impractical (idiom)/large but of no real use
vague and general/not specific/shallow/empty
to skimp/to work half-heartedly/not to bother
